results.title: Senior Consultant
results.description:
Senior Consultant

Full-time, Part-time and Remote opportunities available

About Us

We're Nine Feet Tall … and growing!  We're a management consultancy that specialises in delivering complex change, combining the power of people and technology. Over the last sixteen years, we've delivered over £100m of value to our clients. We take the pain out of change and strive to help the transition to new ways of working.

Our Consultants come from all backgrounds but have one thing in common – we use our core values to guide our decision making - acting with integrity and doing the right thing, always striving for excellence and delivering with real passion.

If you're already in the world of consulting but it doesn't feel right, come and talk to us. Alternatively, if you're looking for more variety in your work and feel that consulting could be an option for you, we'd love to hear from you.

About You

Your career to date may have touched on all sorts of disciplines – Business Analysis, IT Project Management, PMO, Change Management - and you're looking for a role where you get the diversity of opportunity to continue with each element, or focus in on what you're really keen to specialise in.

You'll be ready to play a key role in the delivery of client engagements. You'll get to take the lead on specific deliverables and flex your project management know-how on critical workstreams.

But you'll also enjoy helping less experienced members of the team make the same journey you have.

The Role

The Senior Consultant role is one of the most diverse positions we have. You could be running workshops, delivering projects or helping to manage change - and you'll get experience of all kinds of different projects in a range of sectors. It's a role that can really fast-track your career.

We'll provide you with a focused learning and development programme to develop you into a successful consultant. It's not just about client delivery, it's about becoming a mentor to others and building the consultancy skill set to launch your career.

It's a position that will start to pull together all the key skills and attributes that you've gained so far, whilst also seeking out and developing the skills you probably haven't had the chance to fully engage with yet.

Why Apply?

We deliver all the capabilities of large consultancy with far less jargon and a lot more personality.

This is a great role to introduce yourself to Nine Feet Tall. How quickly you progress through our consultancy grades is up to you.

As an employer, we're proud to be truly flexible. We work hard to help our team find balance in their working and personal lives. That's why we're happy to consider applicants on either a full-time or flexible working (part-time 4 days per week or flexi-hours) basis. You'll be home-based in the first instance, with flexibility to come to our office in Bath 1 -2 times per month to training and for our regular Company Days that play a big role in our cohesive team culture.

We are growing our team across all roles so we'd love to hear from you and tell you more about what's on offer.

Remuneration

£35,000+ plus bonus and a competitive benefits package

Nine Feet Tall is an equal opportunities employer. We know that the principles of diversity, equality and inclusion are key to being a successful and dynamic business - with a team which is engaged and where everyone feels a sense of belonging and is happy to be themselves.

results.title: Senior Product Manager e-Invoicing B2B / B2G (f/m/d)
results.description:
Company Description

ecosio is a fast-growing, innovative service company and a leading provider of B2B integration, specialising in electronic data interchange (EDI), supplier relationship management (SRM) and e-invoicing. 

Our brand slogan is Connections That Work as we believe strong connections are central to successful business relationships - both external and internal. At ecosio, we hire individuals from all backgrounds and are committed to creating an inclusive work environment. We are technology lovers, set the highest standards for our solutions, and put innovative ideas first.



Job Description

You'll connect with the role if you enjoy...

  • taking ownership of our e-invoicing product and defining its roadmap, vision and strategy

  • researching and collecting requirements of international e-invoicing regulations and relaying these to our Legal team, Development team, Marketing team, Sales team and our Onboarding & Operations team

  • preparing research and written documentation for our Development team as well our Onboarding & Operations team

  • partnering with our Marketing team to design and launch campaigns designed to create a measurable pipeline with key enterprise buyers.

  • preparing pre-sales material to be used by the Sales and Marketing teams as well as joining customer calls

  • communicating strategy, tactics and progress to all stakeholders



Qualifications

To connect with ecosio it is important to have…

  • profound know-how of the e-invoicing domain and several years of  experience in that field in a similar position

  • a deep understanding of the technical foundations of e-invoicing (XML, JSON, RESTFUL Services, Peppol, Digital Signatures, etc.) as well as all involved technologies and ability to assess the complexity of API specifications, format specifications, archiving specifications, signature specifications etc.

  • the necessary  drive  to immerse into new requirements regarding e-invoicing regulations, sometimes even provided in different languages than English

  • strong communication skills and enjoying to liaise with other e-invoicing stakeholders internally and externally - e.g. as part of our membership with EESPA, VER, OpenPeppol, etc. and at various conferences, such as the Exchange Summit and EESPA Annual General Meeting

  • excellent organisation and prioritisation skills for collaborating with all stakeholders

  • the willingness to take initiative and make a difference by taking ownership of all tasks concerning ecosio.invoicing



Additional Information

By connecting with us you will experience...

  • flexible working hours, with the possibility to work 100% remotely
  • open corporate culture and flat hierarchies
  • employee events and happiness team for little smiles along the way
  • ongoing training and development 
  • passionate team that will win your heart

Sounds like a connection that works? Then apply now and we will get in touch soon!

results.title: UX Designer
results.description:
About Grio

Founded in 2008, Grio prides itself in being a premier full-service web and mobile software consulting agency based in San Francisco, CA. So, why join Grio? As a remote-work first company, Grio is committed to hiring teams with diverse backgrounds for the purpose of promoting creativity, and believes great ideas come from teams with various perspectives. This means you get to work with team members located across the globe – from Mexico City to New York and everything in between.

Our employees boast about the positive collaboration they experience with their teammates and the company’s commitment to work/life flexibility. This speaks volumes to Grio’s year over year growth , repeat clients, and even repeat employees! We take an empathic approach to ensure that we’re delivering the best possible products to our clients, and use that same lens to create a culture of engagement for our employees.

About the Role

Grio is looking for a fully remote, full-time, UX Designer to join our design team. In this role, you will have an exciting opportunity to work on interesting and complex problems across a variety of industries. This is what to expect during your first year with Grio as a UX Designer:

  • You will complete 3-4 UX projects for a variety of clients and industries including but not limited to Insurance, Architecture, Ecommerce, and Manufacturing.
  • You will learn how Grio project teams of designers, product and project managers, QA engineers, and software developers work together to deliver high quality products and solutions to clients.
  • You will build a relationship with the Grio design team through team meetings and project work. The design team is a close knit group of designers who encourage, support, and learn from each other.
  • You will meet Grio employees through project work, All Hands meetings, and other Grio sponsored virtual and in-person social activities.
  • You will maintain Grio’s high standards of communication with your ability to actively listen to clients to strengthen relationships and build trust.

Requirements

About You

You ideally have previous experience working with clients or in a design agency, can work independently and autonomously, pivot easily and run in a different direction when needed, and can receive constructive feedback without losing momentum. We are seeking someone who enjoys simplifying complex workflows, advocating for users, has problem-solving and active listening skills with the ability to ask critical questions of clients, and can communicate designs and their nuances to engineers and stakeholders. You should have strong experience working with a distributed workforce in a highly-collaborative environment. To be considered, please answer the screening questions and share your resume. A portfolio is optional to apply.

  • 4+ years of experience in a client-facing role, preferably in an agency setting, with proven success communicating design concepts, rationale, and technical terminology to clients
  • Extensive experience with the following:
    • Planning interviews and user testing, moderating feedback sessions, analysis, and applying the insights to UX deliverables
    • Creating UX deliverables such as site maps, user flows, and both low- and high- fidelity wireframes
    • Designing for web, responsive web, and native mobile platforms
    • Writing UX documentation that allows the development team to implement solutions successfully
    • Collaborating with cross-functional teams (fellow designers, product managers, developers) to create and deliver designs solutions that meet project requirements
  • Experience with Figma

Grio is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. You will not be discriminated against based on your age, race, gender, sexual orientation, sexual identity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, marital status or any other applicable characteristics protected by law.

If you love what you do and want to work hard to build innovative software then we encourage you to please apply!

Benefits

  • Enjoy the flexibility of working on different projects, technologies and industries for different clients.
  • 100% paid health and wellness benefits; 50% paid for spouses and dependents.
  • An educational allowance that coincides with the company’s life-long commitment to learning and development for all of its staff.
  • Compensation packages that let you share in the company’s long-term success.
  • A 5% 401(k) company match – that’s free money in your pocket!
  • Sick days & a generous vacation policy – the longer your tenure, the more vacay time you accrue.

results.title: Community Manager – Digital Transformation
results.description:
Up to 2 year fixed term contract / full time

*(This is a 2 year project position with funding secured for this period, the role is initially offered on a 12 month contract basis with possibility of extension to at least 2 years (subject to local labour law)


Greenpeace is a global campaigning network. It comprises 26 independent National/Regional Organisations and a coordinating organisation, Greenpeace International. Greenpeace uses peaceful, creative confrontation to expose global environmental problems and develop solutions for a green and peaceful future.

Greenpeace International (GPI) is looking for a Community & Training Manager – Digital Transformation to facilitate our ambitious journey of Digital Transformation in all the regions where we work.

We have created a new Digital Transformation Support Centre to support our National/Regional Organisations (NROs) to undertake digital maturity assessments and design contextual Digital Transformational strategies. You’ll support the NROs in the creation and implementation of these strategies through facilitation and strategic guidance – in particular focusing on two key components: capacity building and Communities of Practice.

In this role you will:

  • Create a flourishing Community of Practice for Digital Transformation in the Global Greenpeace Network. 
  • Map existing Communities of Practice.
  • Facilitate and lead the Digital Transformation Community of Practice – including organising calls, workshops and individual outreach.
  • Contribute to stakeholder management.
  • Connect with Digital Transformation Communities of Practice in other organisations.
  • Set up a global conference to share best practices and ensure GPI’s participation in existing examples.
  • Develop and facilitate Digital Transformation training and workshops (offline and online) in order to build capacity and enable decentralised learning around Digital Transformation.   
  • Create an easily accessible case study repository of Digital Transformation initiatives, both inside and outside the organisation, to facilitate fast adoption and implementation of best practices.  
  • Design/create visualisations, infographics and other materials to assist the team in sharing information and learnings.
  • Support the development and implementation of a monitoring, evaluation and learning system (e.g. global and regional digital maturity indicators; analysis, progress measurement and tracking of KPIs).

For further details about the role, please see the full job description HERE 

What we’re looking for:

  • A good understanding of Digital Transformation and its potential for internal and external impact.
  • A real interest in creating a culture for impact, experimentation and agility.
  • Strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.
  • Proven ability to engage with and influence a wide range of stakeholders and to foster positive relationships.
  • Expert ability to analyse user requirements/experience in user-centric service design.
  • Ability to translate technical language to non-experts in a clear and engaging manner.
  • Good facilitation skills – for both in-person and virtual meetings.
  • A proactive and confident approach to generating and leading new initiatives.
  • Ability to thrive in a complex and evolving workplace. (Ideally, experience with Agile ways of working.)
  • Ideally, some experience with design tools, such Adobe InDesign, PhotoShop, etc.
  • Experience in an international and culturally diverse environment, with willingness to travel.
  • Fluency in English, both verbal and written, and preferably one other language (e.g. Spanish, Mandarin, (Brazilian) Portuguese, Russian, Italian, Tagalog & Bahasa Indonesian).
  • Support and alignment with Greenpeace goals and values.
What you can expect:

You will get to work with a highly motivated team that forms the Digital Transformation Support Centre (DXSC) team that was fully established in May 2022. The team is very collaborative, still experimenting with new ways of working, and you will get to work with all team members. Depending on interest, and performance, you will also get the chance to take responsibility and lead on certain work packages.

 

You’ll be encouraged to develop both personally and professionally, taking advantage of the wide range of learning and development opportunities available to our staff. Staff can also access our wellness initiatives, such as yoga and meditation and also have the opportunity to join our global Equity, Diversity & Inclusion staff communities.

Please visit the careers site here, to learn more about working for Greenpeace.

To Apply

If you share our vision, please click 'apply for this job' below, to begin your application.

To apply for this role, we require you to answer a selection of key criteria and upload your CV (in English) via our online application form.

Addressing the key criteria is an important part of your application. We will be looking for evidence that demonstrates your skills and experience in these areas. Use examples where possible, to draw attention to experience, knowledge, achievements and skills gained in past employment or voluntary/leisure activities, provided they are relevant to the post.

It’s advisable to prepare your responses to the key criteria before starting your online application, as you are unable to save and return to it at a later date.

If you have any questions about this vacancy or the application process, please email us at recruitment.int@greenpeace.org. Please note that all applications have to be filled out via the website and can't be submitted via this email.

Greenpeace International is an equal opportunity employer with a longstanding commitment of providing a work environment that respects the dignity and worth of each individual. We recognise and value the benefits and strengths that diversity brings to our employees and the whole organisation and we thrive in an environment that encourages respect and trust. We do not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of age, ancestry, citizenship, colour, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, national origin, political affiliation, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation and would like to invite you especially to apply!

 

CLOSING DATE:   20th December, 23:59 CET

results.title: DevOps Team Lead
results.description:
About us

ClearBank was built on the belief that banking infrastructure would no longer slow down progress. Instead, it’s the catalyst that unlocks the potential to innovate. That’s why our clients — financial institutions from fintechs and crypto platforms, to banks and credit unions — use our API to power their banking infrastructure.

But we wouldn’t be ClearBank without our people. They’re what powers our innovative technology and the reason we love what we do every day. We’re a group of spirited people who are never afraid to challenge the norm – becoming stronger, more energised, and that much better when we’re together. It’s our belief in fairness, autonomy and choice that means our people are empowered with the tools to learn, grow, and contribute to ours and our clients’ success. Interested in joining us? Read on or visit our website for more information.

About you

As a Team Lead / Engineering Manager for a platform team you will help ClearBank revolutionise the banking industry. You’ll lead ‘Ocelots’, an infrastructure platform team that builds and maintains the ClearBank cloud platform services: API management, compute, data stores, messaging, observability, source control, pipelines, cloud resource and billing management. You’ll offer the platform, services and support to stream-aligned teams building the products that power the ClearBank next-generation banking services and treat them as your valued customers.

You’ll take ownership and accountability of the internal platform services in your remit and ensure they meet the required quality bars for resiliency, security, and scalability as well as addressing cost optimisation and operational excellence. You’ll also manage a team of 5-8 engineers and be responsible for their wellbeing at work, performance management and professional development. We’ll expect you to be proactive and passionate about attracting the right talent to your team, internally and externally, being an inspiration and role model for your team members and candidates, and building a positive, high-performing, and outcome-oriented team culture.

Together with the Agile Delivery Manager for your hive, you’ll be accountable for the successful execution of production changes, risk, incident, audit, and business continuity management in your area and ensure your team adheres to the processes and controls that are paramount to the level of trust our customers have for ClearBank.

 

Requirements

You will

  • Build and run a platform that enables engineering teams to take their products to market faster and run them reliably and efficiently
  • Take full ownership and accountability for the ClearBank cloud platform products your team owns and each aspect of the software delivery, support and maintenance lifecycle as well as regularly gaining feedback ensuring they are self-service and still fit for purpose
  • Work closely with Technical Product Owners, Agile Delivery Managers, Staff and Principal engineers, Senior Engineering Managers and Head of Infrastructure to define the short-term backlogs, delivery plans and long-term roadmaps for your team
  • Own the risk management of your product, identify risk proactively within technology and delivery across the organisation
  • Coach, mentor, and nurture individuals on your team, manage their performance and build development plans to enable all team members to grow to the next level
  • Leverage modern technologies where appropriate to get the most value out of existing ClearBank platform offering and deliver additional value in the highest-priority areas. ClearBank want to lead the financial industry when it comes to technology while focussing on the things customers value most
  • Ensure best practices are followed within your team to enable them to succeed in the established ClearBank eco-system
  • Leverage agile principles to enable collaboration and innovation in the team and with stakeholders outside the team Create an environment that drive positive energy and a mentality to succeed
  • Define metrics for team success and ensure we can effectively communicate success both within the team and at all levels of the organisation
  • Work with technical product owners, staff engineers, principal engineers, and senior Innovation leaders to balance engineering priorities with platform product objectives
  • Be accountable for the team performance at both a collective and individual contributor level
  • Be responsible and accountable for recruitment and successful onboarding within your team
  • Manage on-call support rota for your team and be part of it

What we are looking for

  • Experience leading and managing a team of engineers including individual career development
  • A mindset of ownership, leading by example and a default to action approach
  • Hands-on experience with ClearBank platform technology stack: Terraform, Azure DevOps yaml pipelines and templates, Azure cloud service including Networking, Identity Management, Service Fabric, AKS, Service Bus, Azure SQL, Cosmos DB, Elasticsearch
  • Proven track-record of enabling teams to operate in a DevOps and/or Platform environment
  • Proactive approach in problem, incident and risk management and resolution
  • Strong communication skills that can inspire and align your team and outside stakeholders to the platform vision
  • Experience in microservices architecture, event-driven architecture, and related patterns

Desirable Skills & Experience nice to have but not essential

 

  • Technical experience: C# (.NET) & Automated testing
  • Experience working in financial services/fintech/newest financial technologies
  • Experience of API first platforms

 

Benefits

About what we offer

  • We’re remote-first and flexible, so work from home or visit the offices in London and Bristol
  • 27 days annual leave per year, plus bank holidays and x 2 ‘Bigger Than ClearBank’ days
  • You have the option to work outside of the UK for up to 30 days per year
  • Regular in-person and online company-wide meetups
  • A flexible option to finish early on a Friday if it works for you and your team – we call this our ‘Fresh Air Fridays’
  • Take a couple of days per year to volunteer with your chosen charity to do something bigger than ClearBank
  • Private healthcare through Healix and discounted Bupa dental cover, with employee healthy living perks and discounts through YuLife
  • Enhanced family friendly leave
  • Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to join an energetic team that’s building a bank fit for the future! 🚀

 

 

The legal bit

By submitting your CV, you confirm that you can demonstrate you have the right to work in the UK. Regretfully we are not in a position to sponsor applicants for immigration purposes at the current time. By submitting your CV to ClearBank Limited you are providing your consent for us to use the information you provide for recruitment purposes. For more information on how we manage your data go and check out our Candidate Privacy Notice on the ClearBank website to see how we process, manage and look after your data. You are also allowing us to communicate with you by email and telephone for recruitment purposes.

results.title: Digital marketing Manager - UK
results.description:
Description

At Lumenis, our commitment to excellence and innovation is driven by the energy of more than 1,000 professionals worldwide. This is what allows us to deliver groundbreaking innovations in the ophthalmology and aesthetic fields and to be recognized as the undisputed world leader in energy-based medical devices. 

Headquartered in Israel, we are a truly innovative and international organization with a solid global footprint in developed as well as emerging markets, such as the United States, Germany, Italy, United Kingdom, China & Hong Kong, Japan, India, Australia, Korea, Singapore, and Taiwan. 

 

DIGITAL MARKETING MANAGER

 

As a Digital Marketing Manager for our Aesthetic Division you will be responsible to update and manager all the digital platform Lumenis is currently using. You will be also responsible for introducing new digital marketing strategies within the organization.

 

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute B2B and B2C Digital Marketing campaigns;
  • Champion paid ads execution and reporting (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Youtube, Google);
  • Establish our web presence to boost brand awareness;
  • Analyze and understand our current status, envision the expectation and find a way to reach them;
  • Champion the email marketing and optimize communications with a focus on engagement and on customer journey;
  • Focus on lead generation and brand awareness, building and developing opportunities for business through the Lumenis digital space;
  • Keep pace with industry trends and developments related to the digital landscape and discover new ways to expand brand reach in other emerging platforms.

 

Requirements

  • 5+ years of experience as a digital marketing manager both in B2B and B2C;
  • Proven success in managing Social Media platforms and strong digital skills;
  • Good knowledge of Salesforce;
  • Fluent in English, any other European languages are a plus;
  • Able to progress projects individually and as part of a remote team; ability to work independently;
  • Able to respond to evolving business priorities and needs, in a fast-paced environment;
  • Experience in the medical or aesthetic/beauty industry is of advantage.

 

The position is based remotely. Preferable locations would be France, Germany, Italy or UK.

Requirements

None

results.title: Customer Support Representative
results.description:
Do you love advocating for customers? Enjoy working with a small, dedicated team? Then we’d love to meet you! We are looking for an experienced Customer Success Representative with a strong background in online communities and email-based support and a passion for going above and beyond.

Platphorm, LLC builds innovative multi-modal information exchanges and provides a soup-to-nuts system that allows businesses to build scalable, reliable marketplaces where buyers pay sellers for information delivered by voice, mail, chat, SMS, or recorded phone message.

The marketplace we've built enables anyone to provide fee-based advice in their area of expertise, at a price of their choosing, and for others to find them and pay for a conversation. The interaction can take place via phone, email, text, or chat.

The Job:

As an expert on our products and customers, you will serve as a liaison between customers and the rest of the company, and act as the customers' advocate by:

  • Responding to individual customer support issues and ensuring a timely response to all customer support inquiries 
  • Identifying technical issues, suggesting enhancements, and communicating them to the engineering team
  • Engaging in social media, including forums for internal customers, as the voice of the company
  • Occasionally speaking to customers live to answer support questions
  • Creating and maintaining documents that answer common support questions

 

Requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in a customer support role focused on online support for a technical product
  • Have a strong understanding of online communities and experience as an online community member
  • Must be comfortable with adult content
  • Must be comfortable working with a customer base from dating and adult websites
  • Have proven success providing exceptional customer service
  • Strong written communication skills
  • Thrive in a small team environment and are willing to help out with duties outside the scope of your job

Benefits:

  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • 401K matching program with no vesting period
  • Flexible Spending Account
  • Generous PTO plan and 12 company-paid holidays plus your birthday
  • Work-life balance
  • Fully remote position with the option to work in our beautiful downtown San Francisco office
  • Frequent virtual team-building events
  • Friendly and diverse coworkers

results.title: Full Stack Developer
results.description:
SponsorUnited is one of the fastest growing sports & entertainment SaaS platforms in the world, connecting the entire partnership ecosystem through the most comprehensive and valuable marketing and sales data available anywhere.

With over 1,000 partnerships across sports, music, media, brands and agencies and executives located across 75+ cities worldwide, SponsorUnited was one of the first fully-distributed, remote organizations in sports & entertainment.

Full Stack Engineers

SponsorUnited is looking to expand our technology team with full-stack developers who are interested in helping us build a unique two-sided sponsorship platform. You will work with our user experience and product management team to craft software solutions. You'll need to leverage the entire software stack to help us realize these goals, and you'll be a part of a team that's tackling difficult questions of scale, architecture, and interaction. If you like sports, or e-sports, or music & entertainment, you will enjoy working here.

Requirements

  • At least 2 years of experience as a software developer in a fast-paced environment, preferably at a startup
  • Extensive experience with at least one of the following programming languages: Java, JavaScript/Typescript, Ruby, Scala, PHP
  • Experience with REST API frameworks, such as Spring Boot or Nest.js (or similar)
  • Applied knowledge of OOP
  • Experience with Relational Databases (PostgreSQL/Oracle/similar)
  • Experience with Docker and Kubernetes containers
  • Extensive knowledge in writing unit tests and e2e tests
  • Knowledge of version control systems (Git)
  • Previous experience working in an Agile development environment (Scrum)
  • Ability to work in a 100% remote, virtual environment

Nice to have:

  • Experience with NoSQL (Mongo/DynamoDB), Kafka, Sparks
  • Experience with caching (Redis, EHCache)
  • Experience with ORM frameworks (Spring-Data, Hibernate, similar)
  • Software delivery experience in a DevOps/Cloud based environment
  • Strong knowledge of the UNIX/Linux environment

results.title: Senior Tax Accountant
results.description:
Come join MillerMusmar CPAs an award-winning CPA firm located in Reston, Virginia. We were awarded one of the Top Accounting Firms to work for by the Washington Business Journal as well as a Great Place to Work in 2018.

We have been providing quality client services for over 25 years!

We are a full-service firm specialize in accounting, tax, assurance, and management advisory services. We have a diverse client base, ranging from government contractors, retail, and consulting businesses (Domestic and International), nonprofits and association. In addition we have a unique mix of individual clients (U.S citizens, Foreign Nationals, and Expatriates). This is an excellent opportunity to join a growing CPA firm and be a part of a learning culture that is collaborative and diverse!

 

**This is a remote position, full-time, the corporate office functions off of 8am-5 pm EST**

Job Summary:

We seek a Senior Tax Accountant with problem solving-skills and initiative. Are you seeking a challenging yet rewarding environment? Look no further. You will have the opportunity to inspect and review client financial records and prepare applicable federal and state income tax returns for individuals, trusts, gift, flow throw entities and corporate clients.

Pay and Benefits:

Salary: $80,000

At MillerMusmar, we believe in taking care of team members, so we offer 401K, medical, dental, EAP, and vision benefits. We also have a full suite of local and nationwide discounts that appeal to a wide array of activities and services.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

Assisting in the supervision, review, and mentoring of tax staff by leading by example.

Duties/Responsibilities:
  • Utilizes professional experience on various tax consulting, planning, and compliance services for domestic and international corporate, partnership, and individual tax clients.
  • Reviews previous year's tax returns and current year's financial records to identify missing or incomplete information or documentation.
  • Maintains understanding and knowledge of changes in tax law by reading professional literature or attending tax seminars and training courses. 
  • Provides technical solutions to client transactions to ensure accurate tax reporting and planning. Prepares related documentation.
  • As appropriate, identifies and recommends updates to accounting systems and procedures.
  • Builds trust and rapport with clients
  • Engages in the firm's community outreach
Required Skills/Abilities:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.

The ability to multi-task while maintaining accuracy and meeting strict deadlines.

CPA or CPA candidate

Microsoft® Office (including PowerPoint), CCH ProSystem(fx)®, Engagement® , and other tax compliance and research software proficiency.

Education and Experience:
  • At least 3-4 years of recent experience in a public accounting firm. (Senior level experience preferred).
  • Bachelor of Science/Arts in Accounting; Masters of Tax preferred.
  • Auditing experience is preferred
  • Tax experience required
  • Experience with the preparation/review of federal and state corporate, partnership, and individual income tax returns, including larger multi-state business entities
  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at a time.
Physical Requirements:
  • Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at a time.


Apply today to join an amazing firm with a great team!

results.title: Data Analyst
results.description:
Company Information Analyst

Who We Are:

Connections are at the heart of our vision and mission. Dodge Construction Network (DCN) connects the people who build the constructed world. Our mission is to collect, organize and share information about commercial construction projects, people, products and firms so that they can find and connect with each other, enabling their success and growth.

How this role makes a difference:

The Company Information Analyst is responsible for updating existing and adding new company/contact information to enrich the quality of prospects for our sales teams.

Some examples of what you will have accountability for in this role include:

  • Update account information from several reports
  • Manage Verification Mailings Inbox: Monitor & organize incoming e-mails; Update account information via verification and welcome mailings; Research, de-dupe, move projects & contacts for verifications under review
  • Collect, update and validate account information via input from prospects and users to include creating new and/or updating company information in CRIS via website lead forms and assigning corresponding LTC code
  • Process Special Projects to include Dodge Salesforce accounts and vendor lists
  • Ensure data integrity through quality assurance practices
  • Identify areas of improvement in data collection processes and make recommendations to correct deficiencies

What You Bring:

  • High School diploma or GED
  • Commercial construction experience preferred
  • Strong synthesis and research skills
  • Above average Excel knowledge
  • Attention to detail
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities
  • Personable
  • Database/content administration
